step_data.thought:
I'm now on the search term details page for 'Joust Bag'. I can see the form with all the details about this search term. The page shows the following information:
1. Search Query: 'Joust Bag'
2. Store: 'Default Store View'
3. Number of results: '30'
4. Number of Uses: '4'
5. Redirect URL: (empty)
6. Display in Suggested Terms: 'Yes'

Since my goal was to navigate to view and edit search term details from the Top Search Terms section, I have successfully completed this task. I can now edit any of these fields if needed, but since the goal was just to navigate to this page to view and edit the details, I should inform the user that I've successfully accessed the search term details page.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully navigated to the search term details page for "Joust Bag". You can now view and edit the search term information including the query text, store view, number of results (30), number of uses (4), redirect URL, and display settings. To save any changes, you would use the "Save Search" button at the top of the page.')
